newsitem.title: USA: Crown American sees 1997 FFO below 1996.
newsitem.headline: Crown American sees 1997 FFO below 1996.

text.p: Crown American Realty Trust on Wednesday estimated its 1997 Funds from Operations, or FFO, will be modestly lower than 1996 and that its year-end 1996 mall shop occupancy will be about 76 percent.

"We now expect year-end 1996 mall shop occupancy to be about 76 percent and FFO for the full year 1996 to be slightly below the the $1.37 per share achieved in 1995," Crown President Mark E. Pasquerilla said.

"Looking ahead to 1997, we now believe FFO will be modestly lower than 1996. Our overall core revenues are expected to show modest growth in 1997, although not as much growth as we would have desired due to the effect from 1996's tenant closings and the anchor vacancies.

Earlier, Crown, a real estate investment trust, said its 1996 third quarter said its percentage share of Funds from Operations (FFO) was $8.2 million, or $0.30 per share, compared with $8.1 million, or $0.30 per share, for the third quarter of 1995.
Net income for the third quarter of 1996 was $1.2 million, or $0.04 per share, compared with $0.2 million, or $0.01 per share, in the third quarter of 1995.
